verses.text: Behold, thou \add art\add* \w fair|strong="H3303"\w*, my \w love|strong="H7474"\w*; behold, thou \add art\add* \w fair|strong="H3303"\w*; thou \add hast\add* \w doves’|strong="H3123"\w* \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \w within|strong="H1157"\w* thy \w locks|strong="H6777"\w*: thy \w hair|strong="H8181"\w* \add is\add* as a \w flock|strong="H5739"\w* of \w goats|strong="H5795"\w*, that \w appear|strong="H1570"\w* from \w mount|strong="H2022"\w* \w Gilead|strong="H1568"\w*.\f + \fr 4.1 \ft that…: or, that eat of, etc\f*

Thy \w teeth|strong="H8127"\w* \add are\add* like a \w flock|strong="H5739"\w* \add of sheep that are even\add* \w shorn|strong="H7094"\w*, which came \w up|strong="H5927"\w* from the \w washing|strong="H7367"\w*; whereof every one bear \w twins|strong="H8382"\w*, and none \add is\add* \w barren|strong="H7909"\w* among them.

Thy \w lips|strong="H8193"\w* \add are\add* like a \w thread|strong="H2339"\w* of \w scarlet|strong="H8144"\w*, and thy \w speech|strong="H4057"\w* \add is\add* \w comely|strong="H5000"\w*: thy \w temples|strong="H7541"\w* \add are\add* like a \w piece|strong="H6400"\w* of a \w pomegranate|strong="H7416"\w* \w within|strong="H1157"\w* thy \w locks|strong="H6777"\w*.

Thy \w neck|strong="H6677"\w* \add is\add* like the \w tower|strong="H4026"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w builded|strong="H1129"\w* for an \w armoury|strong="H8530"\w*, whereon there \w hang|strong="H8518"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w bucklers|strong="H4043"\w*, all \w shields|strong="H7982"\w* of mighty \w men|strong="H1368"\w*.

Thy \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w breasts|strong="H7699"\w* \add are\add* like \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w young|strong="H6082"\w* \w roes|strong="H6646"\w* that are \w twins|strong="H8380"\w*, which \w feed|strong="H7462"\w* among the \w lilies|strong="H7799"\w*.

Until the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w break|strong="H6315"\w*, and the \w shadows|strong="H6752"\w* flee \w away|strong="H5127"\w*, I will \w get|strong="H3212"\w* me to the \w mountain|strong="H2022"\w* of \w myrrh|strong="H4753"\w*, and to the \w hill|strong="H1389"\w* of \w frankincense|strong="H3828"\w*.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft break: Heb. breathe\f*
Thou \add art\add* all \w fair|strong="H3303"\w*, my \w love|strong="H7474"\w*; \add there is\add* no \w spot|strong="H3971"\w* in thee.

¶ \w Come|strong="H0935"\w* with me from \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w*, \add my\add* \w spouse|strong="H3618"\w*, with me from \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w*: \w look|strong="H7789"\w* from the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of \w Amana|strong="H0549"\w*, from the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of \w Shenir|strong="H8149"\w* and \w Hermon|strong="H2768"\w*, from the \w lions’|strong="H0738"\w* \w dens|strong="H4585"\w*, from the \w mountains|strong="H2042"\w* of the \w leopards|strong="H5246"\w*.

Thou hast ravished my \w heart|strong="H3823"\w*, my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*, \add my\add* \w spouse|strong="H3618"\w*; thou hast ravished my \w heart|strong="H3823"\w* with \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, with \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w chain|strong="H6060"\w* of thy \w neck|strong="H6677"\w*.\f + \fr 4.9 \ft ravished: or, taken away\f*

How \w fair|strong="H3302"\w* is thy \w love|strong="H1730"\w*, my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*, \add my\add* \w spouse|strong="H3618"\w*! how much \w better|strong="H2895"\w* is thy \w love|strong="H1730"\w* than \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*! and the \w smell|strong="H7381"\w* of thine \w ointments|strong="H8081"\w* than all \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*!

Thy \w lips|strong="H8193"\w*, O \add my\add* \w spouse|strong="H3618"\w*, \w drop|strong="H5197"\w* \add as\add* the \w honeycomb|strong="H5317"\w*: \w honey|strong="H1706"\w* and \w milk|strong="H2461"\w* \add are\add* under thy \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w*; and the \w smell|strong="H7381"\w* of thy \w garments|strong="H8008"\w* \add is\add* like the \w smell|strong="H7381"\w* of \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w*.

A \w garden|strong="H1588"\w* \w inclosed|strong="H5274"\w* \add is\add* my \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*, \add my\add* \w spouse|strong="H3618"\w*; a \w spring|strong="H1530"\w* shut \w up|strong="H5274"\w*, a \w fountain|strong="H4599"\w* \w sealed|strong="H2856"\w*. \f + \fr 4.12 \ft inclosed: Heb. barred\f*\f + \fr 4.12 \ft shut up: Heb. barred\f*

Thy \w plants|strong="H7973"\w* \add are\add* an \w orchard|strong="H6508"\w* of \w pomegranates|strong="H7416"\w*, with \w pleasant|strong="H4022"\w* \w fruits|strong="H6529"\w*; \w camphire|strong="H3724"\w*, with \w spikenard|strong="H5373"\w*,\f + \fr 4.13 \ft camphire: or, cypress\f*

\w Spikenard|strong="H5373"\w* and \w saffron|strong="H3750"\w*; \w calamus|strong="H7070"\w* and \w cinnamon|strong="H7076"\w*, with all \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* of \w frankincense|strong="H3828"\w*; \w myrrh|strong="H4753"\w* and \w aloes|strong="H0174"\w*, with all the \w chief|strong="H7218"\w* \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*:

A \w fountain|strong="H4599"\w* of \w gardens|strong="H1588"\w*, a \w well|strong="H0875"\w* of \w living|strong="H2416"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*, and \w streams|strong="H5140"\w* from \w Lebanon|strong="H3844"\w*.

¶ \w Awake|strong="H5782"\w*, O north \w wind|strong="H6828"\w*; and \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, thou \w south|strong="H8486"\w*; \w blow|strong="H6315"\w* upon my \w garden|strong="H1588"\w*, \add that\add* the \w spices|strong="H1314"\w* thereof may flow \w out|strong="H5140"\w*. Let my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* into his \w garden|strong="H1588"\w*, and \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* his \w pleasant|strong="H4022"\w* \w fruits|strong="H6529"\w*.
